page.title: 17Recreation Chaldon Hills
page.content: Apart from the Army Camp (see Armed Forces) there is no organised,formal recreational facilities in the block. Recreation is mainly rural orientated and self created,for example:- 1) Shooting, rough to reduce vermin levels, or organised for game birds or deer (which are culled to manageable levels). 2) Walking and horseriding, A considerable network of public rights of way linking with those in other blocks provide routes of varying lengths.The local farmers and the East Dorset Ramblers Association ensure that rights of way are kept clear. 3) Craft work, such as spinning and weaving. Mrs. Simpson of Newlands Farm uses wool from local sheep for this. 4) Gardening, both as a source of food and ornamental.
